page.title: 03St.John's church Croxton
page.content: St.John the Evangelist's Church Croxton serves 49 inhabitants of this hamlet approximatly one mile from Kirmington.The Church which is built of local chalk,has some parts which date back to the 13 century. There is an exquisite panel of the Crucifixion (2foot by 2.5 foot) in the South Window.It is a rood with Our Lady and St. John in pot-metal glass of the 14 century. This church was restored in about 1878, and most unusually a porch erected on the northside.The registers date from May 1566. Croxton church shares a Vicar,resident in Limber,with Kirmington, Limber and Brocklesby. There are services in this Church every second Sunday.
